This is a parametrized Rmarkdown document. It provides a GUI for the user to provide parameters, and an easy way for developers to use those parameters in R code.

## User perspective

To access the graphical user interface, go to _Knit > Knit with Parameters ..._

![](https://i.imgur.com/SgY2me1.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/26PsRsw.png)

Now edit the parameters and "Knit". The underlying R code will now do whatever it's been designed to do.

## Developer perspective

To create a parametrized Rmarkdown document simply add the `param:` field to the YAML header. For example:

```
---
title: "Parametrized Rmarkdown"
params:
  loanbook_path: "loanbook.csv"
  do_match: yes
  do_analyze: no
---
```

Now the each parameter is available via `params$<value>`, for example:

```{r, message=FALSE}
params$do_match
params$do_analyze

path <- params$loanbook_path
readr::read_csv(path)
```
